column4: did anyone have problems with nvidia issue "You do not appear to be using the NVIDIA X driver. Please edit your X configuration file (just run `nvidia-xconfig` as root), and restart the X server."
and nvidia-settings shows this info above and contains only one tab with enable tool tips', 'display status bar' and three other similar option
just follow what it says
open a terminal then type sudo nvidia-xconfig
then reboot..
heh I was doing it but I received black screen after that
after reboot
what driver are you using now? nv? what is your video card?
I have GeForce GT520MX and Ubuntu 11.10
can you pastebin your /var/log/Xorg.0.log
not now - I m on desktop now on job
have no access to my laptop now
anyway it shares with Intel inegrated card via using optimus technology
I have bumblle
and I have drivers from here
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ubuntu-x-swat/x-updates
im not familiar with ppas sorry
Nyles: it has nvidia-current with 295 driver version AFAIK
maybe it doesn't work with optimus technology when Intel is used mostly
maybe? but i think it's best to see the xorg.conf and xorg.0.log im having almost the same problem :)
and finally solved it but not really because im jsut using nv drivers not nvidia..
